explanation: Denotes a person, thing, place, concept, etc.
Expresses an action, state, or occurrence.
Modifies a noun or pronoun, describing its nature or characteristics.
Modifies a verb, adjective, or other adverb, indicating degree, manner, etc.
Replaces a noun or noun phrase to avoid repetition.
Indicates the relationship between a noun/pronoun and other words (time, place, etc.).
Connects words, phrases, or clauses to express logical relationships.
Expresses strong emotion, usually used independently.
Limits the reference of a noun (e.g., this, some, each).
Helps form tenses, voices, or questions (e.g., do, have).
Expresses ability, permission, speculation, etc. (e.g., can, must).
A word part added before a word to change its meaning (e.g., un-, pre-).
A word part added after a word to change its meaning or part of speech (e.g., -ness, -ly).
A shortened form of a word or phrase (e.g., Mr., etc.).
A character representing a specific meaning (e.g., %, $).
